IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: ACCELERATION OF DEVELOPMENT AND ACCESSIBILITY OF MICROBICIDES TO PREVENT THE TRANSMISSION OF HIV.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE INTERNATIONAL PARTNERSHIP FOR MICROBICIDES, INC. (IPM) WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2002 TO ACCELERATE THE DEVELOPMENT AND ACCESSIBILITY OF MICROBICIDES TO PREVENT THE TRANSMISSION OF HIV. ITS GOAL IS TO IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY TO ALL EFFORTS TO DELIVER A SAFE AND EFFECTIVE MICROBICIDE FOR WOMEN IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.
IRS990.Description: THE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT UNIT HAS ESTABLISHED VITAL COLLABORATIONS WITH PHARMACEUTICAL COMPANIES, BIOTECH COMPANIES, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND ACADEMIA TO DEVELOP COMPOUNDS AND WORK ON FORMULATION, SCREENING TECHNOLOGY AND TEST FACILITIES. AS A RESULT OF THE INFRASTRUCTURE ESTABLISHED, COLLABORATING LAB SITES ARE CURRENTLY WORKING ON DRUG SCREENING, SAFETY/EFFICACY EVALUATION AND FORMULATION.

Activity2.Description: THE CLINICAL PROGRAM CONCENTRATED ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF CLINICAL TRIALS IN SUB SAHARAN AFRICA. THIS WAS DONE THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NETWORK OF CLINICAL RESEARCH ORGANIZATIONS AND EXPERTS WITHIN THE FIELD OF CLINICAL TRIAL STUDY. THIS GROUP IS ALSO WORKING TO ESTABLISH A FRAMEWORK TO UNDERSTAND GLOBAL REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS.

Activity3.Description: MANUFACTURING. THE IPM CLINICAL TRIAL MATERIAL FACILITY (CTM), ORIGINALLY BUILT IN 2005, PROVIDES AN "IN-HOUSE" CAPACITY OF APPROX. 15,000 SQUARE FEET TO PRODUCE MICROBICIDE GELS AND RINGS FOR USE IN PHASE I/II CLINICAL TRIALS. IN ADDITION, THE FACILITY ALLOWED IPM TO CONDUCT HANDS-ON PROCESS DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS AIMED AT OPTIMIZING GEL MANUFACTURING PROCESSES AND SCALE-UP PROCEDURES. THE CTM FACILITY GENERALLY HAS NOT BEEN CONTEMPLATED FOR LARGE SCALE PRODUCTION OR COMMERCIALIZATION MANUFACTURE GIVEN THE MAGNITUDE OF THESE EFFORTS FROM EQUIPMENT, LABOR AND CONTROL SYSTEMS. TO ADDRESS THE PHASE III AND COMMERCIALIZATION SUPPLY NEEDS, IPM INTENDS TO ENGAGE CONTRACT MANUFACTURING ORGANIZATIONS WITH EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE IN LARGE SCALE PROCESS DEVELOPMENT, PHASE III SUPPLY CAPACITY, AND EXPERIENCE IN SUPPORTING THE ASSOCIATED REGULATORY COMPLIANCE AND SUBMISSION ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH AN APPROVAL DOSSIERS.

ActivityOther.Description: THE SITE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM HAS CONCENTRATED ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF CLINICAL TRIAL SITES IN SUBSAHARAN AFRICA TO FACILITATE PHASE III CLINICAL TRIALS ON MICROBICIDE SAFETY AND EFFICACY.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: CONTRACTED WITH AN INDIVIDUAL TO ADVOCATE FOR AN INCREASE IN US GOVERNMENT MONIES DEDICATED TO MICROBICIDE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AND ACCESS. THIS GOAL WAS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A LEGISLATIVE STRATEGY MONITORING HOUSE AND SENATE APPROPRIATIONS SUBCOMMITTEES TO ENSURE THAT NECESSARY LANGUAGE IS INCLUDED IN BILLS, MEETINGS WITH POLICYMAKERS AND THEIR STAFFS, AND CULTIVATING ALLY GROUPS AND CONSTITUENT MOBILIZATION.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ADOPTED THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD ON ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, WHICH ADDRESSES THE DETERMINATION OF WHETHER TAX BENEFITS CLAIMED OR EXPECTED TO BE CLAIMED ON A TAX RETURN SHOULD BE RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. UNDER THIS POLICY, THE ORGANIZATION MAY RECOGNIZE THE TAX BENEFIT FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF IT IS MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WOULD BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX POSITIONS AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE ORGANIZATION HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO COMPLY WITH PROVISIONS OF THIS GUIDELINE. THE ORGANIZATION WOULD BE LIABLE FOR INCOME TAXES IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION. GENERALLY, THE ORGANIZATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES BEFORE 2007.
UNREALIZED CURRENCY TRANSLATION -40,894. REALIZED GAIN ON CURRENCY TRANSLATION 1,044,356.

Form990ScheduleFPartV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS OUTSIDE THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleFPartV.Explanation: SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 2: IPM-US PROVIDES GRANT FUNDS TO IPM-BELGIUM. IPM-BELGIUM HAS AN ANNUAL AUDIT AND THE AUDIT REPORT IS PROVIDED TO IPM-US.

FundraiserActivityInformation.Activity: SOLICITATION OF GOV. AND NON-GOV. GRANTS

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: BENEFIT EXTENDED TO ALL EXECUTIVE LEVEL POSITIONS (CHIEF) - 7 TOTAL AND IS NOT TAXABLE.

SEVERANCE PAYMENTS ARE MADE IN CONSIDERATION FOR THE DEPARTING EMPLOYEE SIGNING A WAIVER AND RELEASE AGREEMENT RELEASING IPM OF ALL CLAIMS AND AGREEING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS. JOSEPH ROMANO (CHIEF OF PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT) - $34,800 JANELLE BRYANT (CFO) - $26,923

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DRAFT VERSION IS MADE AVAILABLE ELECTRONICALLY TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE BEFORE SUBMISSION TO THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT WITH THE ORGANIZATION UPON ACCEPTANCE OF EMPLOYMENT TERMS. THE EMPLOYEE DISCLOSES ANY AREAS OF POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND AGREES TO NOTIFY THE APPROPRIATE INDIVIDUALS OF ANY POTENTIAL OCCURRENCES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE SALARY OF THE CEO IS DETERMINED BY REFERENCING INDUSTRY DATA TO IDENTIFY COMPENSATION LEVEL BASED ON RESPONSIBILITIES, SIZE OF ORGANIZATION, AND FUNDING LEVELS. ONCE THE DATA IS ACCUMULATED, THE INFORMATION IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE FINANCE CHAIRPERSON AND COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. UPON APPROVAL, THE INFORMATION IS FORWARDED TO THE HR DEPARTMENT BY IPM'S LEGAL COUNSEL FOR IMPLEMENTATION. ALL CHIEF LEVEL SALARIES ARE SUBJECT TO THE SAME PROCEDURES AS THE CEO SALARY REVIEW PROCESS, WITH ONE EXCEPTION. COMPENSATION LEVEL RECOMMENDATIONS ARE SUBMITTED DIRECTLY TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND DISCUSSION WITH THE CEO. ONCE THE COMPENSATION LEVEL HAS BEEN APPROVED, THE CEO SUBMITS THE RECOMMENDATION TO HR FOR IMPLEMENTATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ALSO PART OF THE ORGANIZATIONS ANNUAL REPORT WHICH IS DISTRIBUTED TO ITS DONORS AND AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: UNREALIZED CURRENCY TRANSLATION -40,894. REALIZED GAIN ON CURRENCY TRANSLATION 1,044,356. TOTAL TO FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 5: 1,003,462.
THE PROCESS FOR OVERSEEING THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT THAT AUDITED THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS HAS BEEN CONSISTENT WITH PRIOR YEARS.
